abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority chairman Thomas F Prendergast says his increasingly combative stance in discussions with New York City officials over authority's capital plan is product of frustration; Prendergast has been pushing city officials to increase city's contributions to plan by more than $2 billion.
lead_paragraph: Thomas F. Prendergast, the chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, has repeatedly called on the city to increase its contribution toward capital projects by more than $2 billion.

headline.main: Tensions Build as M.T.A. Chief Keeps Pressing New York City for More Money
headline.print_headline: Tensions Building as M.T.A. Chairman Keeps Pressure on City for More Money
